channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-1365] Incorrectly MimeType detection for Apache Lucene web site
item.description:
Tika 1.5 detect many page from apache lucene web site as xml, for example this page
http://lucene.apache.org/core/discussion.html

Here are error log:, it failed to parse becuase it use xml parser

Apache Tika was unable to parse the document
at http://lucene.apache.org/core/discussion.html.

The full exception stack trace is included below:

org.apache.tika.exception.TikaException: XML parse error
at org.apache.tika.parser.xml.XMLParser.parse(XMLParser.java:78)
at org.apache.tika.parser.CompositeParser.parse(CompositeParser.java:242)
at org.apache.tika.parser.CompositeParser.parse(CompositeParser.java:242)
at org.apache.tika.parser.AutoDetectParser.parse(AutoDetectParser.java:120)
at org.apache.tika.gui.TikaGUI.handleStream(TikaGUI.java:320)
at org.apache.tika.gui.TikaGUI.openURL(TikaGUI.java:293)
at org.apache.tika.gui.TikaGUI.actionPerformed(TikaGUI.java:247)
at javax.swing.AbstractButton.fireActionPerformed(AbstractButton.java:2018)
item.summary: Incorrectly MimeType detection for Apache Lucene web site

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I attached that page in case it will be changed

Hi Tien Nguyen Manh. Thanks for raising this issue. How are you trying to detect the filetype? Detection seems to be working for me (I renamed the file to page.html):

➜ java -jar tika-app-1.5.jar -d page.html
text/html

Tyler Palsulich Ah yes,
I tried with url directly
java -jar tika-app-1.5.jar http://lucene.apache.org/core/discussion.html
and it failed.
replace the first file that was formatted when saving from browser

Thanks! It looks like the html is malformed, so the parser complains the meta tag isn't closed:

<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">

Arguably, Tika shouldn't throw an exception here... It should just pass over it and grab what it can like a browser would/does. But, I don't see a way to do this other than to just ignore SAXExceptions in XMLParser.parse(), which doesn't seem ideal.
i think XMLParser throws that exception is correct. But the problem is that tika shouldn't detect shouldn't it as XML type, it should be HTML type so that it will use HTMLParser instead of XMLParser

There shouldn't normally be a difference between calling tika on foo.html and http://blah/foo.html (for the same file)

Any chance someone could step through it in a debugger, and try to work out where that difference is coming in?

The reason that Tyler Palsulich test with file and have different result is that in fact the file format was change when i save. I already update that file, the content of that file is identical to url content. And now both test on file and url failed the same way.

Turning the XML parser into a fuzzy parser (like what TagSoup or NekoHTML do) is a big change, and you'd be replicating what those components do in any case. What I think might be in scope here is to improve HTML detection, as the http://lucene.apache.org/core/discussion.html does return a Content-Type of "text/html; charset=utf-8". The main problem is that the HTML is badly broken, as it starts with:

<!-- core-simple.html -->
<head>

Which is really an HTML fragment.
Ah, Tien Nguyen Manh. Good point. I didn't even realize. Ken Krugler, what do you mean, the Content-Type is "text/html"? For me, Tika detects it as xml.

System.out.println(new DefaultDetector().detect(new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream("discussion.html")), new Metadata()));

with the attached file returns

application/xml

which is expected considering that the file starts with a comment and the current magic detection for application/xml includes

<match value="<!--" type="string" offset="0"/>

with priority 50 while the next best matching magic configured for text/html is

<match value="<head" type="string" offset="0:64"/>

with priority 40.

For web request based content type detection it might be helpful to first check java.net.URLConnection#getContentType() (if available) and supply that as Metadata.CONTENT_TYPE.

Some more observations:

  • The lower priority of the text/html magics vs. the application/xml magics was introduced in https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/88b52d66f0f70ca1edc89dc5387c6f74306d4c99 as part of TIKA-560. Goal was to be able to distinguish between text/html and application/x-foxmail. This was achieved by decreasing the priority of the text/html magics below the default of 50.
  • I guess it would have been better to increase the priority of the rather unique application/x-foxmail magic to something above 50.

I would suggest

  • Give the application/x-foxmail magic priority 60.
  • Set the text/html magic priority back to 50.
  • Split the application/xml magics into two and set the priority of the "file starts with comment" magic to something lower than 50 (not that strong indicator of XML).

I can provide a patch if desired.

Hi Tyler - the response from fetching http://lucene.apache.org/core/discussion.html contains a Content-Type of "text/html; charset=utf-8". As Matthias notes above, it would be getter to supply that hint (from java.net.URLConnection#getContentType) to Tika via metadata.

Hi Matthias - I agree that HTML's priority should be higher than XML, and more specific formats like Foxmail should be higher than HTML. A patch would be great, especially if it has a test case for this specific detection issue. And a separate issue for using the Content-type response header would be a bonus

GitHub user mkr opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/35

TIKA-1365: Lower priority for XML starting with comment

TIKA-1365: Lower priority for XML starting with comment, allow HTML starting with comment to be detected as text/html

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/mkr/tika TIKA-1365

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/35.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #35

commit f9655d44978af188018bee81b2d554770ddcd7f9
Author: Matthias Krueger <mkr@mkr.io>
Date: 2015-03-17T21:45:36Z

TIKA-1365: Lower priority for XML starting with comment, allow HTML starting with comment to be detected as text/html

Quick wrapup:

  • HTML starting with comment was detected as application/xml.
  • application/xml has prio 50 magic 0:"<!--" which was preferred over the text/html prio 40 magic for 0..64:"<head"
  • XMLs can start with a comment but then cannot contain processing instructions. It's fair to assume that these are rather exceptional cases.
  • Lowering the 0:"<!--" magic for application/xml prio to 30 allows for detecting both cases: HTML starting with comment (if any other HTML magic still applies), XML starting with comments.

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/35

Thank you Matthias Krueger!

PR #35 merged:

[chipotle:~/tmp/tika] mattmann% svn commit -m "Fix for TIKA-1365  Lower priority for XML starting with comment, allow HTML starting with comment to be detected as text/html contributed by Matthias Krueger <mkr@mkr.io> this closes #35."
Sending        CHANGES.txt
Sending        tika-core/src/main/resources/org/apache/tika/mime/tika-mimetypes.xml
Sending        tika-parsers/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/mime/TestMimeTypes.java
Transmitting file data ...
Committed revision 1667658.
[chipotle:~/tmp/tika] mattmann%

SUCCESS: Integrated in tika-trunk-jdk1.7 #558 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/tika-trunk-jdk1.7/558/)
Fix for TIKA-1365 Lower priority for XML starting with comment, allow HTML starting with comment to be detected as text/html contributed by Matthias Krueger <mkr@mkr.io> this closes #35. (mattmann: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/tika/trunk/?view=rev&rev=1667658)

  • /tika/trunk/CHANGES.txt
  • /tika/trunk/tika-core/src/main/resources/org/apache/tika/mime/tika-mimetypes.xml
  • /tika/trunk/tika-parsers/src/test/java/org/apache/tika/mime/TestMimeTypes.java
